Description: A unique ID for each site consisting of letter(s) followed by a number*
Descriptive sample and/or site detail provided by the collector
Faculty parter responsible for collecting the sample and mailing it to JHU, if applicable
Managed or Unmanaged - describes the human intervention of the sampling location
Date sample was removed from the ground
Latitude coordinate of the site where soil was sampled in decimal degrees
Longitude coordinate of the site where soil was sampled in decimal degrees
Percent impervious surface of the collection site, as a measure of urbanness, as measured by satellite at a 30 m resolution**

column3: *A site is a specific geographic location and may have multiple samples collected there at different time points.

**Higher values indicate concrete, roads, or other hard surfaces nearby. Data were extracted from the NLCD 2016 snapshot: https://www.mrlc.gov/data/nlcd-2016-percent-developed-imperviousness-conus. See also https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isprsjprs.2020.02.019
